Query: How do I find out what filesystem my partitions are using?

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1232648: How to find the mount point for a partition?

Explanations about Options.-t:
Limit the set of printed filesystems. More than one type may be specified in a
 comma-separated list. The list of filesystem types can be prefixed with no to
 specify the filesystem types on which no action should be taken. For more details
 see mount(8).
Explanations about Options.-o:
Define output columns. See the --help output to get a list of the currently
 supported columns. The TARGET column contains tree formatting if the --list or
 --raw options are not specified.
Explanations about Options.-r:
Use raw output format. All potentially unsafe characters are hex-escaped
 (\x<code>).
Explanations about Options.-e:
Convert all tags (LABEL, UUID, PARTUUID or PARTLABEL) to the corresponding device
 names.
Explanations about Options.-n: Do not print a header line.
Explanations about Options.-a: Use ascii characters for tree formatting.

Explanations about Options.-l:
List the partition tables for the specified devices and then exit. If no devices
 are given, those mentioned in /proc/partitions (if that file exists) are used.
